name: Convex Hull
description: The convex hull of a shape is the smallest convex set that contains it.

name: Convex Hull Algorithms
description: A website with visualizations of many convex hull algorithms, including gift wrapping, Graham's scan, quickhull, divide and conquer, monotone chain, and Chan's algorithm.

name: Chan's Algorithm
description: An optimal output-sensitive algorithm to compute the convex hull of a set of points in 2 or 3 dimensions.

name: Kirkpatrick's Point location
description: A data structure and method for point location with O(n) space and O(log n) query time using triangulation.

name: Voronoi Diagrams
description: A partition of a plane into regions close to a given set of points.

name: Fortune's Algorithm
description: A sweep line algorithm for generating the Voronoi diagram in O(n log n) time and O(n) space.

name: Point/Line Duality
description: A type of mathematical duality frequently used in computational geometry algorithms.

name: k-d tree
description: A method of partitioning k-dimensional space in an efficient way for searches like nearest neighbors.

name: Configuration Space
description: The space of possible configurations of an object like a robot.

name: Computational Geometry: Algorithms and Applications
description: A textbook by Mark de Berg, Otfried Cheong, Marc van Kreveld, and Mark Overmars (2008).

name: Computational Geometry in C
description: A popular introduction to the design and implementation of geometry algorithms arising in areas such as computer graphics, robotics, and engineering design by Joseph O'Rourke (1998).

name: Computational Geometry: An Introduction
description: An introductory textbook by Franco P. Preparata and Michael I. Shamos (1993).

name: Algorithmic Geometry
description: A textbook by Jean-Daniel Boissonnat, Mariette Yvinec, and Herve Bronniman (1998).

name: Discrete and Computational Geometry
description: A comprehensive yet accessible introduction to the intermingling of discrete geometry, a relatively new development in pure mathematics, and computational geometry, an emerging area in applications-driven computer science by Satyan L. Devadoss and Joseph O'Rourke (2011).

name: Interactive Computational Geometry
description: A taxonomic approach - An interactive introduction to some of the fundamental algorithms of computational geometry with Mathematica by Jim Arlow (2014).

name: Lecture Notes
description: Lecture notes from CMSC 754 Computational Geometry at the University of Maryland by David Mount (2002).

name: Handbook of Discrete and Computational Geometry
description: A handbook by Jacob E. Goodman, Joseph O'Rourke, and Csaba D. TÃ³th (2017).

name: Handbook of Computational Geometry
description: An overview of key concepts and results in computational geometry by J. R. Sack, and J. Urrutia (1998).

name: Computing in Euclidean Geometry
description: A collection of surveys and exploratory articles about recent developments in the field of computational Euclidean geometry by Ding-Zhu Du and Frank Hwang (1995).

name: CGAL
description: A software project that provides easy access to efficient and reliable geometric algorithms in the form of a C++ library. This website also has explanations of many of these algorithms.

name: Wykobi
description: An extremely efficient, robust, and simple to use C++ 2D/3D oriented computational geometry library.

name: geometry3Sharp
description: Open-Source, Boost-licensed C# library for geometric computing.

name: Computational Geometry Software Libraries
description: UIUC's large collection and library of geometric software by Jeff Erickson.

name: The Stony Brook Algorithm Repository
description: A repository of algorithms based on The Algorithm Design Manual.

name: Geometric Tools
description: A library of source code for computing in the fields of mathematics, graphics, image analysis, and physics that includes some computational geometry algorithms.

name: GeoLib
description: A fast and efficient computational geometry library available in C++, C# and Java.

name: hull.js
description: JavaScript library that builds the convex hull of a set of points.

name: S2 Geometry Library
description: A package for manipulating geometric shapes. Unlike many geometry libraries, S2 is primarily designed to work with spherical geometry, i.e., shapes drawn on a sphere rather than on a planar 2D map. This makes it especially suitable for working with geographic data.

name: Computational Geometry Unity Library
description: A library of computational geometry algorithms for Unity.

name: Symposium on Computational Geometry
description: An annual symposium.

name: The Canadian Conference on Computational Geometry
description: An annual international event for the dissemination of new results in the fields of computational and combinatorial geometry. The conference is usually held in a Canadian city sometime in mid-August.

name: Japan Conference on Discrete and Computational Geometry, Graphs, and Games
description: A conference held annually since 1997, except for 2008.

name: Symposium on Discrete Algorithms
description: ACM-SIAM, held annually.

name: Annual ACM Symposium on Theory of Computing
description: STOC covers all areas of research within Algorithms and Computation Theory.

name: IEEE Symposium on Foundations of Computer Science
description: The flagship conference sponsored by the IEEE Computer Society Technical Committee on the Mathematical Foundations of Computing (TCMF) and covers a broad range of theoretical computer science.

name: Annual Allerton Conference on Communications, Control and Computing
description: Draws some of the brightest minds from industry, academia, and government to discuss innovation in the fields of communication, control, and computing.

name: arXiv
description: Recent submissions to arXiv about computational geometry.

name: Elsevier
description: A forum for research in theoretical and applied aspects of computational geometry.

name: Journal of Computational Geometry
description: An international open access journal devoted to publishing original research of the highest quality in all aspects of computational geometry.

name: HackerEarth
description: A set of articles on computational geometry.

name: TopCoder
description: A set of articles on computational geometry.

name: HackerRank
description: A set of programming problems using computational geometry.

name: GeeksforGeeks
description: Implementations and explanations for a large number of commonly asked questions and common topics in geometric algorithms.

name: MIT OCW
description: A course taught by Nicholas Patrikalakis and Takashi Maekawa in 2013.

name: Udemy
description: A course about implementing computational geometry algorithms in C++.

name: edX
description: A course in computational geometry.

name: Brilliant
description: Practice problems for basic concepts in computational geometry.

name: Brown University
description: A course taught by Roberto Tamassia in 2005.

name: Washington University in St. Louis
description: A course taught by Tao Ju in 2017.

name: The University of Maryland
description: A course taught by Dave Mount in 2002.

name: UC Santa Barbara
description: A course taught by Subhash Suri in 2021.

name: UIUC
description: A course taught by Jeff Erickson in 2022.

name: UC Berkeley
description: A course taught by Jonathan Shewchuk in 2019.

name: Tufts
description: A course taught by Diane Souvaine in 2022.

name: KIT
description: A course taught by Tamara Mchedlidze and Chih-Hung Liu in 2018.

name: The Open Problems Project
description: A project aimed to record important open problems in computational geometry and related fields.

name: Wolfram
description: Documentation for computational geometry algorithms implemented in the Wolfram language.

name: Matlab
description: Documentation for computational geometry algorithms implemented in the Matlab.
